author: senh
title: The Week in Pictures
text: BING NEWS: Peoria Public Schools Superintendent steps down PEORIA, Ill. -- A big shake up at the top of Peoria School District 150. Superintendent Grenita Lathan announced late Tuesday she is resigning. This comes just one day before the school board was scheduled to discuss terminating her contract ... 06/30/2015 - 4:44 pm | View Link Concerned families rally to keep childcare funding PEORIA, Ill. -- Dozens of concerned moms and their children rallied for state lawmakers to pass a budget today. They were outside the Peoria county courthouse to spread their message. If there is not a budget passed by tomorrow many will lose their ... 06/30/2015 - 4:29 pm | View Link State legislators work to try and keep govt. open with no budget SPRINGFIELD,IL--It's deadline day for the a new state budget. As a stalemate continues there's no sign of any progress in Springfield. But state legislators are working on a plan to try and keep basic services operating. House members heard from department ... 06/30/2015 - 3:44 pm | View Link Big R set to make final loan payment to Pekin PEKIN, Ill. -- Pekin is scheduled to be repaid in full after loaning more than $200,000 years ago to bring a new store to town. The City of Pekin and Big R partnered to bring the big box store to town. Big R opened its doors in 2011, and since then, the ... 06/30/2015 - 3:18 pm | View Link Minimum wage workers get raise in Chicago CHICAGO -- Minimum wage workers in the city of Chicago are getting a raise. After months of protests, the first stage of Chicago's plan to raise the minimum wage to $13 an hour takes effect Wednesday. The minimum wage will go from $8.25 to $10. The wage ...
